message: So I am a bit of a Middleman novice, and I hope this is the right place to post this, but I wanted to make sure my thinking on this was correct. Middleman being static, I was planning on using a service like Wufoo to drop in whatever forms were needed for data collection. I then noticed form helpers included in the docs under Template Helpers (http://middlemanapp.com/guides/helpers), and while it makes sense to include them, it got me wondering if there was an approach to forms in Middleman I was missing, or what solutions people have come up with in the past.

The form helpers are basically just to speed up prototyping a site with some forms. You output static and hand it over to a backend team for implementation. There isn't actually a backend with Middleman, so any form would be non-functional unless you used a 3rd party solution like Wufoo.
Just wanted to make sure I wasn't missing anything, or any solution that wasn't obvious or I might have missed. Thanks Thomas (and thanks for a great, and needed, platform).
